other_tests.findings: Ghrelin induced a marked increase in free cytosolic calcium concentration ([Ca2+]i) in 89.5% of corticotropinoma cells from Case 1 and 85% from Case 2.
Initial surgery led to improvement, with postoperative UFC reduced to 302 nmol/24 h and serum cortisol to 9.4 Î¼g/dl.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Six months later, symptoms reappeared with ACTH at 603.5 pg/ml, leading to a second surgery.

other_tests.findings: After the second transsphenoidal surgery, ACTH was not detectable and all biochemical findings normalized.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Post-surgery normalization of both ACTH and cortisol levels.

other_tests.findings: Demonstrated a central/peripheral ACTH gradient greater than 3 and left/right petrosal sinus gradient greater than 1.4.
Detected expression of ghrelin and GHS-R isoforms in adenomatous tissue of corticotropinomas from both patients and additional samples.
